column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Bertha also purchased Hundreds of Paintings. Potter Palmer may not have agreed with her choices but he knew that she had impeccable taste and also a great eye for undiscovered upcoming painters. So Bertha bought what she liked - and Potter paid for it. Luckily
column2: what she liked most were the then unknown painters of Paris like Monet (she bought 30 paintings from him)
column5: Seurat (she bought his masterpiece "Sunday in the Park")
column8: Mary Cassette (she bought more Cassette paintings than any other collector in the world)
column10: and of course Vincent Van Gogh.
